LanguageData.ARA_MimicNematode.label: pseudonematode parasitism
LanguageData.ARA_MimicNematode.description: This colonizer is parasitized by the Arachne pseudonematode. Without intervention, the pseudonematode will eventually kill the host and turn it into an unconscious parasite. The pseudonematode will spread the infection to other bodies through the parasite's aggressive behavior.
LanguageData.ARA_MimicNematode.stages.0.label: dormant period
LanguageData.ARA_MimicNematode.stages.1.label: active phase
LanguageData.ARA_MimicNematode.stages.2.label: terminal stage
LanguageData.ARA_MimicNematode.stages.3.label: Change is coming soon
LanguageData.ARA_MimicNematodeShambler.label: Arachne pseudolinear parasite
LanguageData.ARA_MimicNematodeShambler.description: This corpse has been parasitized and reactivated by Arachne pseudonematodes. The parasitized organisms are slow, have no intelligence, and attack living things indiscriminately. After being active for several days, the parasite dies due to the decline in the host's metabolism. Once captured and fixed, the parasite is unable to move and its life activities cease.
LanguageData.ARA_Rising.label: getting up
LanguageData.ARA_Rising.description: The strong regenerative ability caused by Arachne pseudonematode parasitism has revived this body.
This body has just been ``resurrected'' after being parasitized by Arachne pseudolines.
